item.title: Binary worldlist format
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Nice job frunk. I’m kinda wondering how you came across this; is it parsed on their serverlist page via javascript?

Here’s another implementation:

[code]import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.URL;

public class WorldList {
public World[] worlds;

private WorldList() {
}

public static WorldList newInstance(String worldListAddress) throws IOException {
	WorldList worldList = new WorldList();
	DataInputStream in = new DataInputStream(new URL(worldListAddress).openStream());
	in.skip(4);
	worldList.worlds = new World[in.readShort()];
	for(int i = 0; i < worldList.worlds.length; i++) {
		int j = in.readShort();
		StringBuffer prefix = new StringBuffer();
		byte b = -1;
		while((b = in.readByte()) != 0)
			prefix.append((char)b);
		worldList.worlds[i] = new World(prefix.toString(), j & 0x7FFF, in.readShort(), (j & 0x8000) != 0);
	}
	return worldList;
}

}[/code]

[code]import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;

public class World {
public String prefix;
public int id, players;
public boolean members;

public World(String prefix, int id, int players, boolean members) {
	this.prefix = prefix;
	this.id = id;
	this.players = players;
	this.members = members;
}

}[/code]

item.title: Binary worldlist format
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

incase any of you are noobs and still regex’ing the html

the url-> http://www.runescape.com/slr.ws?order=LPWM

    payloadLength = readInt();
    worldInfoCount = readChar();
    worldInfoArray = new WorldInfo[worldInfoCount];
    for (int i = 0; i < worldInfoCount; i++) {
        WorldInfo worldInfo = worldInfoArray[i] = new WorldInfo();
        int k = readChar();
        worldInfo.isMembers = (k & 0x8000) != 0;
        worldInfo.number = k & 0x7fff;
        worldInfo.locationString = readString();
        worldInfo.players = readShort();
    }

note that the strings are terminated by NUL

Read full topic
